news_header: Kenya has sent over 200 police officers to support multinational forces against gun gangs in Haiti.
news_text: The Kenyan Ministry of the Interior announced the deployment of 217 police officers to assist multinational forces in combating gun gangs in Haiti. This follows Kenya's previous deployment of about 400 officers last year. A total of around 3,000 police forces from various states are expected to join UN and US-backed efforts to stabilize Haiti, where violent criminal groups control much of the capital, Port-au-Prince.
